author: Sunny Hernandez | ahernandez@nyup.com
title: Northern lights forecast upgraded to ‘severe,’ could dazzle Upstate NY tonight (or tomorrow)
text: If you’ve been seeing amazing [aurora borealis photos](https://www.newyorkupstate.com/outdoors/2024/05/upstate-ny-captivated-by-stunning-northern-lights-display-photos-videos.html) taken across Upstate New York and want to catch a glimpse yourself, you might get another chance tonight — or tomorrow. A severe geomagnetic storm alert has been issued for Oct. 10 and 11 by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s Space Weather Prediction Center. The daily aurora forecast is predicting there could be colorful skies across most of Upstate New York during the event. The NOAA says the possible G4 storm caused by a large solar flare could be visible as far south as Alabama and northern California tonight if the skies are clear. Tonight’s event is forecast to have a Kp index of 8 which means the aurora will move even further towards the equator and it will become very bright and very active. The NOAA reports these are the events that create the best aurora and the extended auroral oval will be observable by the most people. Residents in the [United Kingdom](https://x.com/physicsJ/status/1844457718310109652?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Etweet), near London, have already posted photos of aurora-filled skies to social media. New York has had several chances this year to see beautiful night rainbow skies including May, [August](https://www.newyorkupstate.com/outdoors/2024/08/awesome-aurora-see-epic-photos-of-northern-lights-in-upstate-ny.html), [September](https://www.newyorkupstate.com/news/2024/09/aurora-awestruck-northern-lights-dance-above-upstate-ny-photos-video.html) and earlier this [October](https://www.newyorkupstate.com/outdoors/2024/10/will-the-aurora-borealis-appear-above-upstate-ny-this-week-we-like-our-chances.html). Where is the best place to see the northern lights? Head into the darkness if you want the best chance to see the neon skies. Avoid as much light pollution as possible and find a clear view of the horizon facing north. Popular spots include dark sky territory like the [Adirondacks](https://www.newyorkupstate.com/adirondacks/) and clear horizons like Lake Ontario or [Northern New York](https://www.newyorkupstate.com/northern-ny/) bordering Lake Champlain. When will the northern lights appear? Predicting when and where the lights will be visible is not an easy task. The NOAA says the best aurora is usually within an hour or two of midnight, between 10 PM and 2 AM local time, but can appear any time after sunset or sunrise. For an updated aurora forecast, visit [NOAA’s website](https://www.swpc.noaa.gov/communities/aurora-dashboard-experimental) or the [Facebook page](https://www.facebook.com/NWSSWPC) for the Space Weather Prediction Center. How can I photograph the northern lights? You don’t need an expensive camera to capture the auroras. [Visit Iceland](https://www.visiticeland.com/article/how-to-photograph-the-northern-lights-with-a-smartphone), a popular northern lights viewing destination, offers tips to capturing the event with your smartphone. They suggest putting your phone in night mode and adjusting the exposure time if possible to 10-15 seconds to fully capture the sky. A tripod is also helpful to keep your phone steady and your lens in focus. If the northern lights appear tonight, we would love to see your photos. Please send your captures to [features@nyup.com](mailto:features@nyup.com) and make sure to include your name and where the photos were taken.

title: 托马斯·巴赫当选国际奥委会终身名誉主席|托马斯|国际奥委会|巴赫_新浪新闻
text:
当地时间3月19日，在国际奥委会第144次全会上，即将离任的国际奥委会主席托马斯·巴赫当选为国际奥委会终身名誉主席。

　　国际奥委会第144次全会于3月19日至21日在希腊西南部的纳瓦里诺海岸度假村内举行。（总台记者 杨明交）

author: @TheDailyGuardian
title: PM Modi to lay foundation stone of NLC’s 300 MW solar power plant in Rajasthan today
text:
[+](javascipt:void(0);)
Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to virtually lay the foundation stone for a 300 MW solar power plant in Rajasthan today, according to an official statement from the Ministry of Coal. The project, funded with an investment exceeding Rs 1,756 crore, aims to provide affordable power to government entities. NLC India Limited, a leading Navratna CPSE under the Ministry of Coal, is spearheading the initiative in Barsingsar, Bikaner district, as part of the Ministry of New & Renewable Energy’s CPSE Scheme.
The solar project incorporates advanced technology, including high-efficiency bifacial modules made in India, aligning with Prime Minister Modi’s Atma Nirbhar Bharat initiative. The generated electricity will be transmitted through existing power lines of Barsingsar Thermal Power Station, with an annual target of producing approximately 750 million units of green power. This is expected to offset carbon dioxide emissions by around 18,000 million metric tonnes over its lifetime.
The power usage agreement for the project has been finalized with Rajasthan Urja Vikas Nigam Limited at a competitive tariff of Rs 2.52 per unit for the next 25 years. The project is scheduled for commissioning by September 2024, with potential employment opportunities for about 600 individuals during the project phase and 100 personnel during the operations and maintenance phase.
The official statement emphasizes that the project will assist Rajasthan in meeting its renewable purchase obligation while contributing to the nation’s journey towards achieving a net-zero future. NLCIL, operating the 250 MW Barsingsar Thermal Power Station (BTPS), has obtained a 300 MW solar project capacity through competitive bidding in the CPSE Scheme Phase-II Tranche-III facilitated by the Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA).

author: deccanchronicle.com
title: Vijayawada is All Set for Dasara Festivities
text:
Vijayawada is All Set for Dasara Festivities Andhra Pradesh MD Ilyas 19 Sep 2024 7:30 PM GMT x During the meeting, Dhyanachandra stated that the VMC was making arrangements to ensure that the public faces no inconvenience during the festival. (Image By Arrangement) Vijayawada : Vijayawada Municipal Corporation (VMC) commissioner H. M. Dhyanachandra has informed that all the necessary arrangements were made for the Dasara Sarannavaratri festivities at the Sri Durga Malleswara Swamy Varla Devasthanam atop Indrakeeladri, scheduled to take place from October 3 to 12 are being finalised.
The commissioner held a review meeting with officials from different departments on Thursday and discussed the preparations for the Dasara festival. During the meeting, Dhyanachandra stated that the VMC was making arrangements to ensure that the public faces no inconvenience during the festival. The arrangements include arrangement for drinking water facilities, setting up of cloakrooms, sanitation management, temporary toilets and doing patchwork on roads leading to the temple, he said.
"About 35 lakhs of drinking water bottles and packets would be distributed to the devotees. Six cloakrooms, a 24x7 control room and 150 temporary toilets are being set up. A three-shift sanitation management team with 1,400 sanitation workers would be stationed in 27 areas and patchwork would be done on the path for circumambulation (Giri Pradakshina). As in previous years, conveyor belts for Bhavani devotees' red cloth and 18 tractors would also be arranged," he explained.
( Source : Deccan Chronicle )

author: Meteorologist Jason Dunning
title: Forecast: Bright and beautiful start to the new year in SWFL - NBC2 News
text: After a cold and foggy start to the morning, we’re on track to see a bright and beautiful day to kick off the new year. Temperatures will warm up quickly through the morning, with daytime highs landing at 70 degrees this afternoon. The low humidity and sunshine will make for a picture-perfect day if you have any New Year’s Day outdoor plans. If you’re taking the boat out, the wind won’t be much of a factor. Seas will run between 1-2 feet, and inland waters will stay smooth. Expect another night of chilly weather tonight, but it won’t be as cold as the last couple of nights. We’ll wake up Tuesday morning to temperatures in the mid-50s for most of Southwest Florida. We’ll see lots of ups and downs in our temperatures this week, thanks to three cold fronts moving through our area. The first front moves through Tuesday, bringing us a reinforcing shot of cool air but not much rain. The second front moves through Thursday, and the third cold front moves through this weekend. The weekend front will provide us with our best rain chances this week, and we’ll also see some rather windy weather to start the first weekend of 2024.
